Description: Terracotta figure of clothed woman, her himation is wrapped round the waist, leaving her chest explosed (most of chest section lost). White coating preserved on some areas. Pale red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver and gold mica, quartz, and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The three joining pieces (NA407, NA381, NA438) are the pose and style as a fragment from Cyrenaica dated to the mid 4th century BC (Higgins 1954, no.1516).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.345) (Phase 1)
